content.description: <math alttext="H C l, aqueous, plus N a O H, aqueous, react to produce, N a C l, aqueous, plus H 2 O, liquid. Delta H naught equals, negative 57.1 kilojoules per mole of reaction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="2.0em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>57.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ</mtext><mtext>/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The chemical equation above represents the reaction between <math alttext="H C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. When equal volumes of <math alttext="1.00 molar H C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="1.00 molar N a O H, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> are mixed, <math alttext="57.1 kilojoules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>57.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of heat is released. If the experiment is repeated with <math alttext="2.00 molar H C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, how much heat would be released?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
